summary:
A molecular-cell biologist with broad research interests and a passion for understanding inter- and intra-cellular communication. Motivated to both manage and facilitate research programs. Research is driven by both fundamental and clinical questions in the fields of immunology and cancer. To this end, my lab employs a broad-range of in vitro molecular and cell biological approaches, strongly supported by both in vivo and ex-vivo (disease) models. This ‘translatable’ research program has close links with clinical collaborators. I also enjoy an active role in a wide variety of University-associated management functions and am deeply involved in education at both the Masters and PhD program level. This includes being chair of the Utrecht University 'Regenerative Medicine' PhD program.
  
RESEARCH INTERESTS: immunology, cancer, autoimmune diseases, stem cells, regenerative medicine, cell-cell interactions, signal transduction, transcription factors, post-translational modifications, epigenetics, cellular metabolism, autophagy, metastasis, epigenetics, 3D cell culture.
